Lexie Liu

Korean: 刘柏辛

Hometown:

Changsha

Country:

China

Full name:
Liú Bóxǐn
Native name:
刘柏辛
Birthday:
Dec 21, 1998
Age:
26 years old
Blood type:

Introduction

Described as the face of a generation of new Asian artists breaking into the American mainstream with a novel sound that attempts to transcend language barriers (putting out music in Cantonese, Korean, English and Spanish), Lexie Liu's music is characterized by culturally syncretic themes with slick synth-pop production values and a post-cyberpunk aesthetic.

Lexie Liu was offered a spot at YG Entertainment after coming in 4th on 'K-pop Star' and declined, instead choosing the American label 88rising while competing in 'The Rap of China'.

Lexie is also known for being the voice of the 'League of Legends' champion Seraphine for the group K/DA.
